author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...MELISSA BECOMES A HURRICANE AND IS EXPECTED TO RAPIDLY INTENSIFY INTO A MAJOR HURRICANE BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND... ...LIFE-THREATENING AND CATASTROPHIC FLASH FLOODING AND LANDSLIDES EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN HISPANIOLA AND JAMAICA INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...
summary: ...MELISSA BECOMES A HURRICANE AND IS EXPECTED TO RAPIDLY INTENSIFY INTO A MAJOR HURRICANE BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND... ...LIFE-THREATENING AND CATASTROPHIC FLASH FLOODING AND LANDSLIDES EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN HISPANIOLA AND JAMAICA INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... As of 2:00 PM EDT Sat Oct 25 the center of Melissa was located near 16.6, -75.2 with movement WNW at 1 mph. The minimum central pressure was 980 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...MELISSA BECOMES A HURRICANE AND IS EXPECTED TO RAPIDLY INTENSIFY INTO A MAJOR HURRICANE BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND... ...LIFE-THREATENING AND CATASTROPHIC FLASH FLOODING AND LANDSLIDES EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN HISPANIOLA AND JAMAICA INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... As of 2:00 PM EDT Sat Oct 25 the center of Melissa was located near 16.6, -75.2 with movement WNW at 1 mph. The minimum central pressure was 980 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Melissa (AT3/AL132025)
